us.ihmc.euclid.geometry

Class BoundingBox2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.BoundingBox2D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoundingBox2DBasics, BoundingBox2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<BoundingBox2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<BoundingBox2D>

    public class BoundingBox2D
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoundingBox2DBasics, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.EpsilonComparable<BoundingBox2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Settable<BoundingBox2D>, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox2D>
    A BoundingBox2D can be used to define from a set of minimum and maximum coordinates an axis-aligned bounding box in the XY-plane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BoundingBox2D()
      Creates a new bounding box initialized with both its minimum and maximum coordinates to (0, 0).
      BoundingBox2D(BoundingBox2DReadOnly other)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to other.
      BoundingBox2D(double[] min, double[] max)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.
      BoundingBox2D(double minX, double minY, double maxX, double maxY)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.
      BoundingBox2D(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly min, us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly max)
      Creates a new bounding box and initializes it to the given minimum and maximum coordinates.

    • Method Detail

      • createUsingCenterAndPlusMinusVector

        public static BoundingBox2D createUsingCenterAndPlusMinusVector(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Point2DReadOnly center,
                                                                us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DReadOnly plusMinusTuple)
        Creates a new bounding box 2D from its center coordinate center and a tuple 2D holding onto half its size plusMinusTuple.

        The minimum and maximum coordinates of the resulting bounding box are calculated as follows:

        • minPoint = center - plusMinusTuple
        • maxPoint = center + plusMinusTuple

        Parameters:
        center - the center coordinate of the new bounding box. Not modified.
        plusMinusTuple - tuple representing half of the size of the new bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new bounding box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if any of the minimum coordinates is strictly greater than the maximum coordinate on the same axis.

      • union

        public static BoundingBox2D union(BoundingBox2DReadOnly boundingBoxOne,
                                  BoundingBox2DReadOnly boundingBoxTwo)
        Creates a new bounding box such that it is the smallest bounding box containing the two given bounding boxes boundingBoxOne and boundingBoxTwo.
        Parameters:
        boundingBoxOne - the first bounding box. Not modified.
        boundingBoxTwo - the second bounding box. Not modified.
        Returns:
        the new bounding box.

      • geometricallyEquals

        public boolean geometricallyEquals(BoundingBox2D other,
                                   double epsilon)
        Compares this to other to determine if the two bounding boxes are geometrically similar, i.e. the distance between their min and max points is less than or equal to epsilon.
        Specified by:
        geometricallyEquals in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.GeometricallyComparable<BoundingBox2D>
        Parameters:
        other - the bounding box to compare to. Not modified.
        epsilon - the tolerance of the comparison.
        Returns:
        true if the two bounding boxes represent the same geometry, false otherwise.
